id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group.
id.notes: All id data elements are shown as required so that that every data group can be explicitly identified. Almost no other data elements are shown as required but they may be required by specific rulesets.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

ruleset_model_descriptions.description: A list of the ruleset model descriptions within the project each with a unique ruleset_model_type.
ruleset_model_descriptions.notes: For submissions with ruleset model descriptions (i.e., user, proposed, baseline,..) generated as separate files, only one model description would be defined for each ASHRAE229 ruleset project description json file. For submissions where the software always produces all ruleset model descriptions together, multiple model descriptions would appear in the same ASHRAE229 ruleset project description json file. Some rulesets may restrict the submission process including the number of files and number of model descriptions per file. Multiple model descriptions may be required by rulesets that require models at various tiers or levels of performance. Model descriptions may also be used by References between data groups and are restricted to be within the same ruleset model description. For 90.1-2019 appendix G model descriptions would be created for the following models: user, proposed, baseline at 0 degrees, baseline at 90 degrees, baseline at 180 degrees, and baseline at 270 degrees. All IDs within a ruleset model description should be unique for each type of data group. Between ruleset model descriptions, IDs should be the same for the same component. For example, a Surface with an ID of LobbyFrontSurface is very likely to have the same geometry for all ruleset model descriptions except perhaps the azimuth so that surface should have the ID LobbyFrontSurface for all ruleset model descriptions.

compliance_path.description: Indicates the chosen compliance path if the ruleset has multiple compliance paths such as 90.1 Appendix G has code compliance and beyond code

output_format_type.description: Indicates the chosen format for output

id.description: Unique data set identifier
id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

schema_author.description: Name of the organization that published the schema
schema_author.notes: Identifies the organization that defined the schema. Is should be set to: ASHRAE SPC 229 Schema Working Group

schema_name.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content. It should be set to Ruleset Evaluation Schema

schema_version.description: The version of the schema the data complies with
schema_version.notes: Common versions may include 0.0.36 from the first public review period. This is the value of the version field in the top of the ASRAE229.schema.json file or the version in the ASHRAE229.schema.yaml Schema data group.

schema_url.description: The Uniform Resource Locator (url) for the schema definition and/or documentation

author.description: Name of the entity creating the serialization
author.notes: Identifies the organization that created the file

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

time_of_creation.description: Timestamp indicating when the serialization was created
time_of_creation.notes: Updated anytime any data content is modified.

version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
version.notes: Used by data publisher to track revisions of the data. Shall be incremented for each data revision

source.notes: Used by data publisher to document methods (e.g., software and version) used to generate data. **Informative note:** `source` may be different from other data source(s) included elsewhere within the data

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

notes.description: Additional Information

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

type.description: Describes the current ruleset model description for rulesets with multiple simulation models
type.notes: Will usually designate which simulation this RulesetModelDescription refers to such as: PROPOSED, BASELINE_0, USER, RATED, REFERENCE

transformers.description: Electrical transformers at the building site
transformers.notes: Contains a list of transformers that convert electricity from a higher voltage to one used by the building, exterior lighting, and other services at the site.

buildings.notes: Contains a list of buildings on the site (often just one).

schedules.description: Schedules for internal loads, thermostats, equipment operation and control, and any other need.
schedules.notes: Contains a list of schedules used in model.

materials.description: Materials used at the site in Construction layers
materials.notes: Contains a list of Materials used in Construction layers.

constructions.notes: Contains a list of Constructions used in Surfaces.

measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.description: Differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values.
measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.notes: Used as rating conditions for air leakage for a building. The most common values used are 50 Pa or 75 Pa since they correspond to common rating conditions. For the model of actual building value this value would be measured but for created baseline or reference model this could be an assumed value.

is_measured_infiltration_based_on_test.description: Indicates whether the differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values is based on pressure testing of the building.

altitude.description: Altitude of the building at ground level.
altitude.notes: Altitude of the building site above sea level and used for adjusting airflows. If the altitude is not provided, it is assumed to be zero and airflows are already normalized to sea level.

fluid_loops.notes: Contains a list of fluid loops on the site that are not child loops. In primary/secondary piping systems or more complicated piping systems, this data element should include a list of the the primary loops. Child loops should appear in FluidLoop.child_loops.

service_water_heating_distribution_syste.description: Service water heating systems on the site
service_water_heating_distribution_syste.notes: Contains a list of service water heating distribution systems at the site.

service_water_heating_equipment.description: Service water heating equipment on the site
service_water_heating_equipment.notes: Contains a list of service water heating equipment at the site.

service_water_heating_uses.description: Service water heating uses on the site
service_water_heating_uses.notes: Contains a list of service water heating uses at the site. Used in BuildingSegment and Space data groups, see notes in those locations.

external_fluid_sources.notes: The sources of energy, such as district chilled water, district hot water, and district steam.

site_zone_type.notes: The site designation type for exterior lighting classification.

calendar.description: Information on the calendar used with the simulation.

weather.description: Information on the local weather conditions used with the simulation.

model_output.description: Model output for a single instance

descriptions: The building model as described without consideration of the ruleset
notes: The proposed building model typically transformed from the USER model following specific changes for the ruleset

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

building_segments.description: Large portions of a building that share a building area type
building_segments.notes: Contains a list of building segments in the building.

elevators.notes: Contains a list of elevators in the building.

exterior_lighting.notes: Contains a list of exterior lighting systems for the building.

refrigerated_cases.notes: Contains a list of refrigerated cases in the building.

building_open_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule indicating when the building is open
building_open_schedule.notes: One represent when the building is open and zero when closed. If the schedule is not present, 24 hour operation is assumed. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

has_site_shading.description: Indicates whether the site has features that cast shadows on the building

number_of_floors_above_grade.notes: For the entire building including all building segments. Includes only floors that are not devoted solely to parking or unconditioned space.

number_of_floors_below_grade.notes: For the entire building including all building segments. Includes only floors that are not devoted solely to parking or unconditioned space.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

number_of_floors_above_grade.notes: For the portion of the building represented by the BuildingSegment.

number_of_floors_below_grade.notes: For the portion of the building represented by the BuildingSegment.

is_all_new.description: Indicates whether the building segment is completely new construction (true) or existing (false).
is_all_new.notes: Projects that include additions should have a building segments that are existing (false) and for the addition (true). Curtain rules such as baseline fenestration area will apply differently to each portion.

zones.notes: Contains a list of zones in the building.

heating_ventilating_air_conditioning_sys.description: HVAC systems in the building segment
heating_ventilating_air_conditioning_sys.notes: Contains a list of HVAC systems in the building.

area_type_vertical_fenestration.description: Building area classification used for vertical fenestration
area_type_vertical_fenestration.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

lighting_building_area_type.notes: The lighting building area type for the building segment. If used, options are provided in the ruleset specific enumerations. This data element may also be used for determining the building area type for other purposes such as target setting targets (like 90.1 building performanc factors) so it should be completed even when the lighting building area method is not used.

area_type_heating_ventilating_air_condit.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_area_type.description: Service water heating area type classification
service_water_heating_area_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_uses.description: List of IDs of service water heating uses
service_water_heating_uses.notes: This data element also appears in Space. A list of references to ServiceWaterHeatingUse data groups. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse that has one of the following unit types: [POWER_PER_PERSON, POWER_PER_AREA, VOLUME_PER_PERSON, VOLUME PER AREA] AND has not been explicitly referenced by any spaces is assumed to apply to each space in the building segment. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse that is referenced by one or more spaces will be applied only to those spaces. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse with units POWER, VOLUME, or OTHER will be applied only once to the entire building segment. The constraint to use when implemented is to :ServiceWaterHeatingUse:

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group
id.notes: No multipliers or floor multipliers are used with the Zone data group so each zone should be individually identified.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

spaces.notes: Contains a list of spaces in the building.

floor_name.notes: Used to group zones on a floor. Zones with the same floor name are on the same floor. Numbers may be used as part of the floor name such as Level 1. If a number is used it should increase for increasing heights and use negative values for stories generally below ground. The floor name should generally correspond to numbering of floors on the plans.

surfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the zone.

infiltration.notes: References a single infiltration data group. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates and schedules should be aggregated to the zone.

design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for cooling during occupied hours
design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.notes: The cooling setpoint temperature for the zone at design conditions.

thermostat_cooling_setpoint_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the cooling setpoint temperatures
thermostat_cooling_setpoint_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the design thermostat cooling setpoint is assumed to be constant. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for heating during occupied hours
design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.notes: The heating setpoint temperature for the zone at design conditions.

thermostat_heating_setpoint_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the heating setpoint temperatures
thermostat_heating_setpoint_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the design thermostat heating setpoint is assumed to be constant. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

minimum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the minimum relative humidity setpoint
minimum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.notes: For schedule values use relative humidity expressed on a 0 to 1 scale. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

maximum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the maximum relative humidity setpoint
maximum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.notes: For schedule values use relative humidity expressed on a 0 to 1 scale. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

terminals.notes: Multiple terminals may be used such as from a VAV system, a DOAS, and a baseboard.

served_by_service_water_heating_system.description: ID of the ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem serving the zone
served_by_service_water_heating_system.notes: Contains the ID of the service water heating distribution system serving the zone. The ID is a unique identification for a specific ServiceWaterHeatingSystem data group. Constraint to use when implemented :ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem:

transfer_airflow_rate.notes: Net transfer air. Positive values indicate transfer air in to the zone and negative values show transfer out of the zone.

transfer_airflow_source_zone.description: ID of the Zone for the source of transfer air.

zonal_supply_fans.description: A list of zonal supply fans
zonal_supply_fans.notes: A list of references to one or more fans that is used to supply air to the zone. The fan should be configured to not be connected from any other HVAC data group. This may include fans used in a non-mechancial applications typically for warehouses with high air change rates.

supply_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedules.description: A list of IDs for Schedules containing the multipliers for the zonal supply airflow rates
supply_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedules.notes: Each schedule corresponds to the list in zonal_supply_fans. If a schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

zonal_exhaust_fans.description: A list of zonal exhaust fans
zonal_exhaust_fans.notes: A list of references to one or more fans that is used to exhaust air from the zone. The fan should be configured to not be connected from any other HVAC data group. This may include fans used in a non-mechancial applications typically for warehouses with high air change rates.

exhaust_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedule.description: A list of IDs for Schedules containing the multipliers for the zonal exhaust airflow rates
exhaust_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedule.notes: Each schedule corresponds to the list in zonal_exhaust_fans. If a schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

air_distribution_effectiveness.notes: The zone air distribution effectiveness as defined in ASHRAE Standard 62.1 and shown as Ez.

aggregation_factor.notes: A factor that has already been applied when modeling a zone that represents an aggregation of several individual zones shown on design documents. For example, if five dwelling units facing the same orientation are modeled as a single zone, the total volume of the zone and the total surface area of the zone should be five times the values of a single dwelling unit shown on the design documents and aggregation_factor should be set to 5. Another example, when three identical floors are modeled, the zones modeled for these floors should represent the volume of the zone on three floors, and the aggregation_factor should be set to 3. A final example would be a big box retail store with eight units serving the core zone, the total floor area of the spaces in the core zone should already account for the total area, and the aggregation_factor should be set to 8. The factor is chiefly used to determine the size range for heating and cooling equipment serving that zone. Used only to confirm the individual size of heating or cooling units serving the zone so that the efficiency for that size range can be looked up in tables of equipment efficiency by size range. By dividing the heating and cooling capacity of the zone by the aggregation_factor, the result would indicate the capacity of the individual units represented by equipment. For zones not representing any type of aggregation, this value should be one. The aggregation_factor is typically an integer but occasionally may include a fractional value. The total area of the spaces and the volume of the zone should already be multiplied by the factor.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

interior_lighting.description: Internal lighting that produce internal gains for a space.
interior_lighting.notes: References one or more InteriorLighting data groups that collectively define all interior lighting within the space.

miscellaneous_equipment.description: Miscellaneous equipment loads that produce internal gains for a space.
miscellaneous_equipment.notes: References one or more MiscellaneousEquipment that collectively describe all of the miscellaneous equipment in the space.

floor_area.description: The floor area of the space.
floor_area.notes: The floor area of a space within the building, including basements, mezzanine and intermediate-floored tiers, and penthouses with a headroom height of 7.5 ft or greater. It is measured from the exterior faces of walls or from the center-line of walls separating buildings, but excluding covered walkways, open roofed-over areas, porches and similar spaces, pipe trenches, exterior terraces or steps, chimneys, roof overhangs, and similar features. This is the floor area that is modeled.

number_of_occupants.description: Number of occupants in the space

occupant_multiplier_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the multiplier for the number of occupants
occupant_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

occupant_sensible_heat_gain.description: Sensible heat gain of each occupant.

occupant_latent_heat_gain.description: Latent heat gain of each occupant.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc.

function.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

envelope_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used. Often refered to as occupancy type.

lighting_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

ventilation_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_area_type.description: Service water heating area type classification
service_water_heating_area_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_uses.description: List of IDs of service water heating uses
service_water_heating_uses.notes: This data element also appears in BuildingSegment. A list of references to ServiceWaterHeatingUse data groups. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse that has one of the following unit types: [POWER_PER_PERSON, POWER_PER_AREA, VOLUME_PER_PERSON, VOLUME PER AREA] AND has not been explicitly referenced by any spaces is assumed to apply to each space in the building segment. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse that is referenced by one or more spaces will be applied only to those spaces. A ServiceWaterHeatingUse with units POWER, VOLUME, or OTHER will be applied only once to the entire building segment. The constraint to use when implemented is to :ServiceWaterHeatingUse:

notes: A compartment or chamber, to which one or more ducts are connected, that forms a part of the air-distribution system and that is not used for occupancy or storage. The area of a plenum is not counted toward the floor area of a building.

An unoccupied, unfinished, narrow space within a building, between the ground and the first (or ground) floor. The crawl space is so named because there is typically only enough room to crawl rather than stand; anything larger than about 1 to 1.5 metres (3 ft 3 in to 4 ft 11 in) and beneath the ground floor would tend to be considered a basement. The area of a crawl space is not counted toward the floor area of a building.

The area of load bearing surfaces located above or below occupied building floors that is not available for general occupancy often due to inadequate clear headroom or lack of provisions for egress, and containing building structure or services predominantly serving adjacent floors or to provide access to such systems. They are not part of the air distribution systen, conditioned, used for occupancy, or used for storage. Interstitial spaces often contain ducts, piping, conduit, and other components that serve the building systems. The area of a interstitial space is not counted toward the floor area of a building.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

modeling_method.description: The software methodology chosen for modeling infiltration

algorithm_name.description: Name of the algorithm used for modeling infiltration in the specific simulation engine.

measured_air_leakage_rate.description: Meaured air leakage rate from infiltration of outside air
measured_air_leakage_rate.notes: Based on the pressure described in ASHRAE229.measured_infiltration_pressure_difference. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates should be aggregated to the zone.

flow_rate.notes: Infiltration flow rate for simulation infiltration models unadjusted for temperature difference or windspeed or schedule often with a windspeed at 10 mph (4.5 m/s).  This may vary in meaning between simulation engines. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates should be aggregated to the zone.

multiplier_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the multiplier for the infiltration
multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates and schedules should be aggregated to the zone. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

descriptions: Weather Driven. The amount of air leakage is determined by using the infiltration_flow_rate with a correlation usually involving windspeed, height, and the difference between indoor and outdoor temperature and is then multiplied by the schedule.
Pressure Based. The amount of air leakage is determined by induced airflows from pressure differences between zones, air distribution system components, the outside due to wind speed and direction.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

subsurfaces.description: Subsurfaces that are on the surface
subsurfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the space.

classification.notes: Options for surface being interior or exterior wall, floor, or ceiling.

area.notes: Measured from interior face area. It is the gross area of the wall and includes the area of all subsurfaces.

tilt.description: Angle between vertical and the surface outward normal
tilt.notes: Example value would be 0 = roof, 90 = wall, 180 = downward facing surface (exterior floor)

azimuth.description: Clockwise angle between North and the horizontal projection of the wall's outward normal.
azimuth.notes: Example values would be 0 = north, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West. For rulesets with baseline rotations, the angle of the azimuth should be different for each baseline rotation.

adjacent_to.description: Used to classify the conditions on the surface.
adjacent_to.notes: Determines whether the other side of the surface is modeled and if not what assumptions should be used.

adjacent_zone.description: ID of the adjacent Zone for interior surface. Only required when adjacent zone is explicity modeled when adjacent_to is set to INTERIOR.
adjacent_zone.notes: Each interior surface between two zones should be described only once as a surface. No duplication of an interior surface facing each zone is necessary. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

does_cast_shade.description: Determines whether the surface is modeled as casting shade on other exterior surfaces

construction.description: ID of the Construction description of surface or an ID of another Construction.
construction.notes: The construction data group can either appear here or a reference to an ID of a Construction used in a previous Surface. The constraint to use when implemented is to :Construction:

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

classification.description: Classification for the subsurface being window, skylight, door.

fraction_framing.description: Fraction of the construction that is framing.
fraction_framing.notes: Fraction of the construction using framing_layers, the remaining portion uses the primary_layers. If blank, assume zero framing.

primary_layers.description: List of IDs for materials as layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for the primary heat path
primary_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the cavity. For constructions with homogeneous layer, use this element only. Air films should not be included in the list of layers. When Construction.primary_layers are specified, the Construction.r_values should not be used. The list of primary_layers should include at least one Material that has mass with Material.density and Material.specific_heat specified. The constraint to use when implemented is to :Material:

framing_layers.description: List of IDs for materials as layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for the  framing heat path
framing_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the framing otherwise leave blank. Air films should not be included in the list of layers. Only used when primary_layers is also populated. The constraint to use when implemented is to :Material:

insulation_locations.description: List of locations for the insulation related to the surface that correspoond to the values in the r_values list. Only used when r_values are specified.
insulation_locations.notes: The items in the list of r-values should directly correspond to the items in the list of insulation_locations.

u_factor.notes: Includes interior and exterior air films as specified by the referenced standard.

c_factor.notes: Typically used to describe the thermal perfromance of constructions used in below grade walls. It is the time rate of steady-state heat flow through unit area of a material or construction, induced by a unit temperature difference between the body surfaces. Note that the C-factor does not include soil or air films.

f_factor.notes: Typically used to describe the thermal perfromance of constructions used in slab-on-grade floors. It is the heat transfer through the floor, induced by a unit temperature difference between the outside and inside air temperature, on the per linear length of the exposed perimeter of the floor.

r_values.description: List of r-value of the insulation for the surface that correspond to values in the insulation_locations list
r_values.notes: When Construction.r_values are specified, the Construction.primary_layers should not be used. The items in the list of r-values should directly correspond to the items in the list of insulation_locations.

descriptions: Continous insulation on exterior of an above ground wall
Continous insulation on interior of an above ground wall
Insulation within the cavity of an above ground wall that fills the entire cavity
Insulation within the cavity of an above ground wall that fills only part of the cavity
Insulation on underside of the slab covering the perimeter
Insulation fully covering the underside of the slab
Insulation applied vertically next to edge of slab

thickness.description: The thickness of the material layer

thermal_conductivity.description: The thermal conductivity of the material layer
thermal_conductivity.notes: When thermal_conductivity is specified, r_value should not be provided.

density.description: The density of the material layer

specific_heat.description: The specific heat of the material layer

r_value.description: r-value of the insulation for the material layer
r_value.notes: When r_value is specified, thermal_conductivity should not be provided. Typically used for insulation or air gaps.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

absorptance_thermal_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_thermal_exterior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_solar_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_visible_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_thermal_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_thermal_interior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_solar_interior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_visible_interior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

descriptions: Exterior wall or roof which is adjacent to the exterior environment.
Slab-on-grad or below grade surface if adjacent to ground.
Interior surface if adjacent to another space which is explicity modeled.

Surface adjacent to a environment identical to the space. Sometimes this is described as adiabatic surface since no heat is transfered. The space on the other side of the surface is not explicity modeled.
The surface adjacency cannot be determined by the software.

has_open_sensor.description: Has sensor and reports to building control system when the window or door is open.

opaque_area.description: Area of subsurface framing for a window or skylight or opaque portion for a door.

energy_type.description: Source of energy for the miscellaneous equipment in the space
energy_type.notes: To indicate that the energy is not accounted for by any utility supplied source, choose NONE. To indicate equipment with a energy source from a Loop choose STEAM, HOT_WATER, or OTHER

power.description: Power for miscellaneous equipment in the space
power.notes: The value of power for the miscellaneous equipment in the space that when multiplied by the schedule is the consumption of power (for electricity or other energy_type's) for each period in the schedule.

multiplier_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the multiplier for miscellaneous equipment power in the space.
multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

sensible_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a sensible load on the space.
sensible_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

latent_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a latent load on the space.
latent_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

remaining_fraction_to_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop for the remaining fraction
remaining_fraction_to_loop.notes: If sensible_fraction and latent_fraction add up to less than 1.0 and this field is specified then the chilled water or condenser water loop specified gets the remaining fraction of the miscellenous load. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

energy_from_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop serving as the source of energy
energy_from_loop.notes: References the loop that is the source of energy for the miscellenous equipment. Example would be hot water that is used for laundry in the zone. When this is used the energy_type should be set to OTHER. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

automatic_controlled_percentage.description: Fraction of receptacles that have automatic controls.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

hourly_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values. A year that does not have a leap day should be a list of 8760 values and a leap year should be a list of 8784 values. All schedules for a project should be consistently either a list of 8760 values or a list of 8784 values but not mixed within a project. The list of values is in standard time with no adjustment for daylight savings time.

hourly_heating_design_day.description: Hourly values for heating design day
hourly_heating_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Populate only one of the data elements: hourly_heating_design_day and hourly_heating_design_year, not both.

hourly_heating_design_year.description: Hourly values for heating design year
hourly_heating_design_year.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Use when more than a 24 hour period was used for sizing. Values with the value Null will be ignored. Populate only one of the data elements: hourly_heating_design_day and hourly_heating_design_year, not both. A year that does not have a leap day should be a list of 8760 values and a leap year should be a list of 8784 values. All schedules for a project should be consistently either a list of 8760 values or a list of 8784 values but not mixed within a project. The list of values is in standard time with no adjustment for daylight savings time.

hourly_cooling_design_day.description: Hourly values for cooling design day
hourly_cooling_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Populate only one of the data elements: hourly_cooling_design_day and hourly_cooling_design_year, not both.

hourly_cooling_design_year.description: Hourly values for cooling design year
hourly_cooling_design_year.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY.  Use when more than a 24 hour period was used for sizing.  Values with the value Null will be ignored. Populate only one of the data elements: hourly_cooling_design_day and hourly_cooling_design_year, not both. A year that does not have a leap day should be a list of 8760 values and a leap year should be a list of 8784 values. All schedules for a project should be consistently either a list of 8760 values or a list of 8784 values but not mixed within a project. The list of values is in standard time with no adjustment for daylight savings time.

event_times.description: Event times when the schedule changes
event_times.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT to describe the time of the year in seconds that the schedule changes value.

event_values.description: Event value at corresponding event time.
event_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values.

event_times_heating_design_day.description: Event times when the schedule changes for heating design day

event_values_heating_design_day.description: Event value at corresponding event time for heating design day
event_values_heating_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second.

event_times_cooling_design_day.description: Event times when the schedule changes for cooling design day

event_values_cooling_design_day.description: Event value at corresponding event time for cooling design day
event_values_cooling_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second.

type.notes: Primarily indicates if the values may be represented by units such as C for temperature or W for power or m3/s for flow rate or are dimensionless multipliers.

prescribed_type.description: Options when any schedule values have changed from what appears in the schedule library
prescribed_type.notes: Some rule sets prescribe which schedules to use for modeling purposes. This option indicates if the schedule is as prescribed or has been modified.

is_modified_for_workaround.description: True if any schedule has been modified for a workaround
is_modified_for_workaround.notes: Not all technologies can be modeled directly in the simulation program.  Modifiying schedules is a common workaround for modeling some technologies.  This flag is used to indicate when a schedule has been modified for this purpose.

data_source_type.description: Data source use for the weather file.

climate_zone.description: The designation of the climate zone where the building is located
climate_zone.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

cooling_dry_bulb_design_day_type.description: The frequency of occurance type for cooling design day based on dry-bulb temperature

This includes all unique full height building levels adjacent to the elevator shaft that are between the top and bottom floors where the elevator opens. Exclude levels serving only parking garages or other levels explicity not part of the building.

motor_location_zone.description: ID of the Zone where the heat from the motor goes
motor_location_zone.notes: When specified, it is the zone the heat from the elevator motor get added to. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

motor_heat_fraction.description: Fraction of heat from the motor that is added as a sensible load zone.

cab_location_zone.description: ID of the Zone where the heat from the cab goes
cab_location_zone.notes: When specified, it is the zone the heat from the cab get added to to the zone including lighting heat, fan heat, and accessory heat. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

cab_heat_fraction.description: Fraction of heat from the cab that is added as a sensible load zone.
cab_heat_fraction.notes: When specified, it is the fraction of the heat from the cab that gets added to the zone including lighting heat, fan heat, and accessory heat

is_variable_speed_motor.description: If the elevator uses a variable speed motor drive

motor_power.description: Elevator average hourly peak motor power
motor_power.notes: The motor power can be provided either together with or, instead of, the detailed elements used to calculate it.

cab_ventilation_fan_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

cab_motor_multiplier_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule containing the multiplier for the elevator motor operation
cab_motor_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

fan_system.notes: One FanSystem for each HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem so if a direct outdoor air system is used a second Zone Terminal should be specified with a separate HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem.

heating_system.notes: References the HeatingSystem data group that acts as the main heating system or coil for this HVAC System.  If the HVAC system does not have a heating system, this entry can be left blank, or the HeatingSystem HeatingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE.

cooling_system.notes: References the CoolingSystem data group associated with this HVAC System.  If the HVAC system does not have a cooling system, this entry can be left blank, or the CoolingSystem CoolingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE.

preheat_system.notes: References a HeatingSystem data group that provides preheat to this HVAC System. Preheat is typically a coil used to temper cold air entering an HVAC systm often when high quantities of outdoor air is expected. If the HVAC system does not have a preheat system, this entry can be left blank, or the HeatingSystem HeatingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE in the referenced data group.

notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

type.notes: System configurations that typically are at the zone and include a compressor (such as packaged terminal air conditioning, packaged terminal heat pumps, window air conditioning units, and water loop heat pumps) should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem and CoolingSystem. Systems that include gas or electric furnaces should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem. Distributed systems where each zone is individually served by dedicated fans and/or coils (such as four-pipe fan coil, two-pipe fan coil, radiant systems, baseboards, chilled beams, and variable refrigerant flow indoor units) should be reported in the schema using Terminal with the cooling and heating described in the cooling_source and heating_source data elements (and any other relevant Terminal Data elements). Evaporative cooling systems should be described in CoolingSystem. Passive diffusers with no coil or fan should be described in Terminal.

energy_source_type.description: Source of energy for the heating system

hot_water_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop providing the hot water

water_source_heat_pump_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop containing water source heat pumps

design_capacity.notes: Design capacity may be determined by sizing performed by the software.  This value should be provided if sized by the simulation software as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

rated_capacity.notes: At rating conditions. The rated capacity is generally used to determine efficiency level when efficiency level is based on size. It is net heating capacity taking into account the heat from the indoor fan.

oversizing_factor.description: The oversizing factor applied to the peak load that results in the heat capacity. Zero indicates no oversizing. Negative numbers indicate undersizing.
oversizing_factor.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

is_calculated_size.description: True if the component is sized by software
is_calculated_size.notes: Determined in accordance with generally accepted engineering standards. For capacities determinined by software, including the simulation software, this should be true. For capacities that are autosized values should be true. Typically when true, the sizing is based on one or more design days, or other time periods, and should be consistent with the weather.heating_design_day_type. For capacities reflecting the an actual piece of equipment this should be false.

heating_coil_setpoint.description: Setpoint of the air leaving the heating coil
heating_coil_setpoint.notes: The setpoint of the air leaving the heating coil at design conditions.

efficiency_metric_values.description: List of efficiency metric values that correspond to the descriptors in efficiency_metric_types list
efficiency_metric_values.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

efficiency_metric_types.description: List of efficiency metrics that correspond to the values in efficiency_metric_values list
efficiency_metric_types.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

heatpump_auxiliary_heat_type.description: Heatpump auxiliary heat type used for backup

heatpump_auxiliary_heat_high_shutoff_tem.description: Heatpump auxiliary heat high temperature shutoff
heatpump_auxiliary_heat_high_shutoff_tem.notes: The auxiliary heat is available at or below this outside temperature to satisfy the load. If this temperature is higher than heatpump_low_shutoff_temperature then between the two temperatures, the heat pump is energized first and if any load remains, then the auxiliary heat is energized.

heatpump_low_shutoff_temperature.notes: The heat pump is available at above this outdoor temperature to satsify the load. The heat pump is always energized first to meet any heating load prior to the use of auxiliary heat. For heat pumps with no lower temperature limit, this value should not be provided or else set to Null.

design_sensible_cool_capacity.notes: Designed sensible cooling capacity. Design sensible capacity may be determined by sizing performed by the software. This value should be provided if sized by the simulation as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

rated_sensible_cool_capacity.notes: At rating conditions. The rated capacity is generally used to determine efficiency level when efficiency level is based on size.  It is net sensible cooling capacity taking into account the heat from the indoor fan.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

supply_fans.notes: List of fans that supply air by the HVAC system and are located in the building.

return_fans.notes: List of fans that return air to the HVAC system and are located in the building.

exhaust_fans.notes: List of fans that exhaust air from the building either at the air handler or located in various spaces. The fans are located in the building.

relief_fans.notes: List of fans that exhaust air from the building at the air handler to maintain proper pressurization. The fans are located in the building.

air_economizer.description: Air side economizer related to the fan system

air_energy_recovery.description: Air side energy recovery related to the fan system

temperature_control.description: Cooling supply air temperature control type
temperature_control.notes: The options describe the controls during cooling operation.

has_lock_out_central_heat_during_unoccup.description: Locks out the use of central heating during unoccupied hours
has_lock_out_central_heat_during_unoccup.notes: Typically used when zone has heating coil available that can serve unoccupied heating load.

reset_differential_temperature.description: Supply air temperature reset differential temperature at minimum cooling load
reset_differential_temperature.notes: When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE this temperate is added to the supply air temperature at minimum cooling load conditions. When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_DIFFERENTIAL_TEMPERATURE this temperate is the temperate below space tempature when no cooling load. The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal.

supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.description: Supply air temperature reset load fraction during cooling operation
supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.notes: When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE, this is the threshold fraction below which supply air temperature reset begins.  Between the stated load fraction and 0% load the supply air temperature is ramped linearally until the supply air temperature reaches the zone. The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal.

supply_air_temperature_reset_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule for the supply air temperature reset during cooling operation
supply_air_temperature_reset_schedule.notes: The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

fan_volume_reset_fraction.notes: When fan_volume_reset_type is DESIGN_LOAD_RESET this is the fraction of the design load that corresponds to minimum air flow. When fan_volume_reset_type is OPERATING_CAPACITY_RESET this is the fraction of the instanteous operating capacity that corresponds to minimum air flow.

operating_schedule.description: ID of the Schedule indicating operation
operating_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the fansystem  is always operating. Schedule values of zero when fan is scheduled to be off and one when the fan is scheduled to be on. While a zero indicates the fan is off, it may still be activated during that hour by other controls such as providing fan cycling at night to maintain the unoccupied set point. No values beside 0 and 1 are allowed. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

minimum_airflow.notes: The minimum airflow may be determined by sizing performed by the softare. This value should be provided if sized by the simulation software as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

minimum_outdoor_airflow.notes: If the minimum_outdoor_airflow is equal to the maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume that indicates a constant volume dedicated outdoor air system. If only the  maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume but the minimum_outdoor_airflow is lower that indicates an air side economizer.

maximum_outdoor_airflow.notes: If the minimum_outdoor_airflow is equal to the maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume that indicates a constant volume dedicated outdoor air system. If only the  maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume but the minimum_outdoor_airflow is lower that indicates an air side economizer.

air_filter_merv_rating.description: The MERV rating of the air filter

has_fully_ducted_return.description: If the fan system has fully ducted return.

is_integrated.notes: When the economizer is integrated with the mechanical cooling system it is capable of providing partial cooling even when additional mechanical cooling is required to meet the remainder of the cooling load.

design_airflow.notes: The design airlow may be determined by sizing performed by the software. This value should be provided if sized by the simulation software as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

is_airflow_calculated.description: True if the airflow is sized by software
is_airflow_calculated.notes: Determined in accordance with generally accepted engineering standards. For air flows determinined by software, including the simulation software, this should be true. For air flows that are autosized values should be true. Typically when true, the sizing is based on one or more design days, or other time periods, and should be consistent with the weather.heating_design_day_type and weather.cooling_design_day_type. For air flows reflecting the an actual piece of equipment this should be false. If the air flow is a calculated sum of hardcoded zone air flow values this should be false.

specification_method.description: Options for how the fan is specified
specification_method.notes: Indicates if the fan is specified using the SIMPLE method of just the design electric power or using the DETAILED method of using pressure rise, nameplate power, shaft power, total efficiency, and motor efficiency.

design_electric_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Simple.

design_pressure_rise.description: Pressure rise through fan at design flow conditions
design_pressure_rise.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed

motor_nameplate_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

shaft_power.notes: Power delivered to the fans shaft and does not include the mechanical drive losses. Equivalent to fan brake horsepower for inch-pound units. Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

total_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed. It includes the overall efficiency of the combination of the fan, drive, and motor.

motor_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

motor_heat_to_airflow_fraction.description: Fraction of motor heat added to the airflow.
motor_heat_to_airflow_fraction.notes: Fraction to airflow plus fraction to zone do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

motor_heat_to_zone_fraction.description: Fraction of motor heat added to the zone.
motor_heat_to_zone_fraction.notes: Fraction to airflow plus fraction to zone do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

motor_location_zone.description: ID of the Zone where the heat from the motor goes
motor_location_zone.notes: When specified, it is the zone the heat from the fan motor get added to. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The airflow and power should be directly related. A minimum number of four points is recommended. Certain rulesets may have a different minimum number of points. For example, 90.1 Appendix G expects 11 data points. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

airflow.notes: No name and id is needed since typically used as one of a series.

power.notes: The rate of energy used by the fan at the given airflow.

Specify the brake horse power, design pressure rise through, total efficiency, motor efficiency

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

type.notes: System configurations that typically are at the zone and include a compressor (such as packaged terminal air conditioning, packaged terminal heat pumps, window air conditioning units, and water loop heat pumps) should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem and CoolingSystem. Systems that include gas or electric furnaces should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem. Distributed systems where each zone is individually served by dedicated fans and/or coils (such as four-pipe fan coil, two-pipe fan coil, radiant systems, baseboards, chilled beams, and variable refrigerant flow indoor units) should be reported in the schema using Terminal with the cooling and heating described in the cooling_source and heating_source data elements (and any other relevant Terminal Data elements). Evaporative cooling systems should be described in CoolingSystem. Passive diffusers with no coil or fan should be described in Terminal.

served_by_heating_ventilating_air_condit.description: ID of the HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem serving the terminal
served_by_heating_ventilating_air_condit.notes: Contains ID of the HVAC system serving the terminal - from Unique Identification Number in HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem. Constraint to use when implemented :HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem:

heating_source.notes: Used for terminal heating including reheat.

heating_from_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop providing heating
heating_from_loop.notes: Only used when heating_source is hot water. Used for terminal heating including reheat. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

cooling_from_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop providing cooling
cooling_from_loop.notes: Only used when cooling_source is chilled water. Used for terminal cooling including radiant and fan coils. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

fan.notes: The fan data group associated with the terminal.  If no fan is modeled for this terminal, this field should be left blank.

primary_airflow.notes: Zone terminal primary airflow at design conditions.

maximum_heating_airflow.notes: Entry only needed if maximum heating airflow is different than the pimary airflow such as when describing a dual maximum VAV box control.

supply_design_heating_setpoint_temperatu.description: Zone terminal supply design heating temperature setpoint

supply_design_cooling_setpoint_temperatu.description: Zone terminal supply design cooling temperature setpoint

minimum_outdoor_airflow.description: Zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow
minimum_outdoor_airflow.notes: This value should be provided if fan airflow determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided. This should be the design flow of outdoor air based on an occupied space using the appropriate ventilation standard such as ASHRAE Standard 62.1. Adjustments to lower the value for demand controlled ventilation should be made using the minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_schedule.

minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.description: ID of the Schedule containing the multiplier for zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow
minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Often used to indicate the reduced flow needed when the space has reduced occupancy when a demand controlled ventilation control is used. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity for baseboard or radiant system or reheat
heating_capacity.notes: Only includes the heating capacity of the terminal for hot water or electric coil. This value should be provided if determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided.

cooling_capacity.description: Cooling capacity for the radiant system or cooling coil
cooling_capacity.notes: Only includes the cooling capacity of the terminal for chilled water coil for radiant or fan coil.  This value should be provided if determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided.

is_supply_ducted.description: True if the the supply is ducted.
is_supply_ducted.notes: Packaged terminal air conditioners (PTAC), packaged terminal heat pumps (PTHP), and window or through the wall air conditioners should be False and other DX systems including rooftop units should be True

has_demand_control_ventilation.description: True if the zone has demand control ventilation
has_demand_control_ventilation.notes: The zone is either served by an air handler that responds to demand control ventilation signals from that zone or is served by a DOAS that specifically provides air to that zone on demand.

is_fan_first_stage_heat.description: True if the the only source of first stage heating is the heat from the fan itself
is_fan_first_stage_heat.notes: Only appropriate with variable volume boxes that are fan powered

The energy consumption per unit time should be directly related to the load on the boiler and entering water temperature. A minimum number of sixteen points is recommended. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list of operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

operation_lower_limit.description: Heating load range operation, lower limit
operation_lower_limit.notes: The heating rate below which the boiler will not operate. This is often used in plants that have multiple boilers to specify how they should be sequenced.

operation_upper_limit.description: Heating load range operation, upper limit
operation_upper_limit.notes: The heating rate above which the boiler will not operate. This is often used in plants that have multiple boilers to specify how they should be sequenced.

entering_water_temperature.notes: Temperature of water entering the boiler which returned from the loop. This entry is optional since not all curves for boiler performance need this.

cooling_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop connected to the Chiller for supplying chilled water
cooling_loop.notes: Data elements linking data groups by reference that don't make sense without the reference are shown as required. Few other data elements than this type and id data elements are shown as required. Other data elements may be required by specific rulesets. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

condensing_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop connected to the Chiller that provides condensing water
condensing_loop.notes: No condensing loop name implies air-cooled chiller. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

chiller_function.description: Function such as chilled and/or hot water
chiller_function.notes: This is used to help classify chillers but other data elements in this data group are describing the operation during cooling mode for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

energy_source_type.description: Source of energy for the chiller
energy_source_type.notes: Select the primary source of energy for the chiller (often electricity). For chillers such as engine-driven or absorption that have both non-electric and electric inputs, provide the input that drives the refrigeration process, usually the non-electric input.

design_capacity.notes: The capacity of the chiller at design conditions. This should correspond with the design_entering_condenser_temperature and design_leaving_evaporator_temperature. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

rated_capacity.notes: The capacity of the chiller at rating conditions. This should correspond with the rated_entering_condenser_temperature and rated_leaving_evaporator_temperature. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

rated_entering_condenser_temperature.notes: The rated outside air dry-bulb temperature for air cooled chillers or design entering condenser water temperature for water cooled chillers. For AHRI conditions for inch-pound ratings for air cooled chillers are 35C/95F and water cooled are 29.4C/85F. The AHRI conditions for SI ratings are 35C for air cooled chillers and 30C for water cooled. This should correpond with the rated capacity and the FULL_LOAD_EFFICIENCY_RATED and INTEGRATED_PART_LOAD_VALUE. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

rated_leaving_evaporator_temperature.notes: For AHRI conditions for inch-pound ratings are 6.7C/44F. For AHRI conditions for SI ratings are 7C. This should correpond with the rated capacity and the FULL_LOAD_EFFICIENCY_RATED and INTEGRATED_PART_LOAD_VALUE. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

minimum_unload_ratio.description: Minimum unload ratio of full load allowed
minimum_unload_ratio.notes: The ratio of current load to available capacity at a given simulation time step. Used only when this value is higher than the minimum_load_ratio.  Between the minimum_unload_ratio and the minimum_load_ratio, the chiller creates a false load in order to continue operating at the minimum_unload_ratio.

minimum_load_ratio.description: Minimum fraction of full load allowed
minimum_load_ratio.notes: The ratio of current load to available capacity at a given simulation time step. Below the minimum load ratio, the chiller cycles on and off.

design_entering_condenser_temperature.notes: The temperature entering the condenser portion of the chiller at design conditions. The design outside air dry-bulb temperature for air cooled chillers or design entering condenser water temperature for water cooled chillers. This should correpond with the design_capacity and the FULL_LOAD_EFFICIENCY_DESIGN and NONSTANDARD_PART_LOAD_VALUE. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

design_leaving_evaporator_temperature.notes: The temperature leaving the evaporator portion of the chiller at design conditions. This should correpond with the design_capacity and the FULL_LOAD_EFFICIENCY_DESIGN and NONSTANDARD_PART_LOAD_VALUE. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

efficiency_metric_values.description: List of efficiency metric values that correspond to the descriptors in efficiency_metric_types list
efficiency_metric_values.notes: The useful cooling energy supplied by the chiller divided by the energy into the chiller (usually electricity) both in the same units when the chiller is supplying a predefined load. The element should describe the value during cooling mode operation for chillers even for chillers that operate in multiple modes.

efficiency_metric_types.description: List of efficiency metrics that correspond to the values in efficiency_metric_values list

capacity_operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The capacity should be directly related to the chilled water supply temperature and condenser temperature. A minimum number of sixteen points is recommended. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list of operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

power_operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The power should be directly related to the chilled water supply temperature, condenser temperature, and load on the chiller. An indicator that the chiller is at full capacity is also important to differentiate between fully loaded and partially loaded operation. A minimum number of 64 points is recommended but fewer may be adequate to confirm proper operation especially if the temperatures and load are not repeated. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list of operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

is_chilled_water_pump_interlocked.description: Indicates if the operation of the chilled water pump is interlocked with the operation of the chiller
is_chilled_water_pump_interlocked.notes: Should be set to true when the chiller and the chiller water pump are controlled to turn on an off at the same time.

is_condenser_water_pump_interlocked.description: Indicates if the operation of the condenser water pump is interlocked with the operation of the chiller
is_condenser_water_pump_interlocked.notes: Should be set to true when the chiller and the condenser water pump are controlled to turn on an off at the same time.

heat_recovery_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop connected to the chiller for supplying recovered heat

heat_recovery_fraction.notes: Fraction of total rejected heat that can be recovered at full load

is_at_full_capacity.notes: True if chiller is operating at full copacity for the given temperature conditions

power.notes: The rate of energy used by the chiller at the given operating point.

Few other data elements than this type and id data elements are shown as required. Other data elements may be required by specific rulesets. Constraint to use when implemented :ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem:

efficiency_metric_types.description: List of efficiency metrics that correspond to the values in efficiency_metric_values list

efficiency_metric_values.description: List of efficiency metric values that correspond to the descriptors in efficiency_metric_types list

draw_pattern.notes: Draw pattern refers to the water draw profile in the uniform energy factor test. See 10 CFR 430 Appendix E Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Water Heaters for more information.

operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The power should be directly related to the load. A minimum number of four points is recommended. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

compressor_location.description: Description of where the heat pump for the water heater is located
compressor_location.notes: Used when compressor is not located in a specific zone. From CBECC-Com.

compressor_zone.description: ID of the Zone where the heat pump for the water heater is located
compressor_zone.notes: From CBECC-Com. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

compressor_heat_rejection_source.notes: Indicates the type of location for the component but does not indicate if it impacts the simulation, see compressor_heat_rejection_zone. From CBECC-Res.

compressor_heat_rejection_zone.description: ID of the Zone for rejecting heat pump heat
compressor_heat_rejection_zone.notes: When present, it indicates that heat transfer into or out of the component turns into a cooling or heating load in the simulation. From CBECC-Res. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

compressor_capacity_operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The capacity should be directly related to the evaporator_air_temperature, condenser_water_temperature, evaporator_air_flow, and condenser_water_flow. A minimum number of 64 points is recommended but fewer may be adequate to confirm proper operation especially if the temperatures and flows are not repeated. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list of operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

compressor_power_operating_points.notes: Used to confirm the proper operation at various conditions which is based on the nominal value and performance curves, performance maps, or other adjustment mechanism. The power should be directly related to the chilled water evaporator_air_temperature, condenser_water_temperature, evaporator_air_flow, condenser_water_flow, and load on the heat pump water heater. A minimum number of 64 points is recommended but fewer may be adequate to confirm proper operation especially if the temperatures and flows are not repeated. The ruleset checking specification would normally provide a list of operating points that should match what is provided by the simulation.

has_electrical_ignition.description: Indicates whether the water heater has electrical ignition

tank.description: Tank that is part of the service water heating equipment
tank.notes: Contains a storage tank that is part of the service water heating equipment.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

solar_thermal_systems.description: Solar thermal systems used for heating service water
solar_thermal_systems.notes: Contains a list of Solar thermal systems that are part of this service water heating distribution system.

hot_water_loop.description: ID of the FluidLoop for hot water
hot_water_loop.notes: Can be used when heat is supplied to service water heater from a hot water loop or when combination service water and space heating is used. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

notes: See 10 CFR 430 Appendix E Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Water Heaters for more information.
Units are watts and can be converted from STANDBY_LOSS_FRACTION based forumulat found in CBECC-Res User Manual
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of a conditioned location.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of a semi-conditioned location. It is usually kept warm enough to prevent freezing and often only cooled by passive ventilators.
The component location has thermal properties similar to the outdoors.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of a garage. It may or may not have passive ventilators and share an insulated wall with a conditioned zone.

The component location has thermal properties similar to those of an attic. It may have passive ventilators or not, is often warmer during summer, especially on sunny days, and may share an insulated ceiling with a conditioned zone.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of a crawl space beneath a building. It may or may not have passive ventilators and share an insulated floor with a conditioned zone.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of an underground area.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of an unconditioned area other than one of the other enumerations in this list.
The component location has thermal properties similar to those of an area not otherwise described by a different enumeration.

load.notes: No name and id is needed since typically used as one of a series.

power.notes: The rate of energy used per unit time by the service water heating at the given load.

evaporator_air_temperature.description: Outside dry bulb temperatures of air
evaporator_air_temperature.notes: No name and id is needed since used as one of a series.

capacity.notes: The capacity available by the heat pump water heater at the given operating point.

evaporator_air_temperature.notes: No name and id is needed since used as one of a series.

power.notes: The rate of energy used by the heat pump water heater at the given operating point.

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

storage_capacity.description: Storage capacity of tank in distribution system

interior_insulation.notes: Insulation that is part of the tank and is inside of the housing. From CBECC-Res.

exterior_insulation.notes: A blanket of insulation that surrounds the exterior of the tank. From CBECC-Res.

location.notes: Indicates the type of location for the component but does not indicate if it impacts the simulation, see location_zone. From CBECC-Res.

location_zone.description: ID of the Zone containing the Tank
location_zone.notes: When present, it indicates that heat transfer into or out of the component turns into a cooling or heating load in the simulation. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:
